perturbation.original_text: The Servicer may grant extensions, refunds, rebates or adjustments on any Receivable or amend any Receivable according to the Servicing Procedures. However, if the Servicer (i) grants payment extensions resulting in the final payment date of the Receivable being later than the Collection Period immediately preceding the Final Maturity Date for the latest maturing Class of Notes, (ii) cancels a Receivable or reduces or waives (including with respect to any Upgrade Offer) the remaining Principal Balance under a Receivable or any portion thereof and/or as a result, the monthly payments due thereunder, or (iii) modifies, supplements, amends or revises a Receivable to grant the Obligor under such Receivable a contractual right to upgrade the related Device, it will acquire the affected Receivable solely as described under Section 3.3, unless it is required to take the action by Law.
perturbation.changed_text: The Servicer may grant extensions, refunds, rebates or adjustments on any Receivable or amend any Receivable according to the Servicing Procedures. However, if the Servicer (i) grants payment extensions resulting in the final payment date of the Receivable being later than the Collection Period immediately preceding the Final Maturity Date for the latest maturing Class of Notes, (ii) cancels a Receivable or reduces or waives (including with respect to any Upgrade Offer) the remaining Principal Balance under a Receivable or any portion thereof and/or as a result, the monthly payments due thereunder, or (iii) modifies, supplements, amends or revises a Receivable to grant the Obligor under such Receivable a contractual right to upgrade the related Device, it will acquire the affected Receivable solely as described under Section 3.3, even if it is required to take the action by Law.
perturbation.explanation: By changing "unless it is required to take the action by Law" to "even if it is required to take the action by Law", the modification creates a contradiction. This section initially allows the servicer to avoid acquiring the Receivable if required to take the action by law. The change now enforces acquisition regardless of legal requirements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law; Conflicts with Statutory Obligations

perturbation.original_text: (a) If the Servicer receives notice of a Proceeding against it, the Servicer will, if a claim for indemnity will be made, promptly notify the Depositor, the Issuer, the Owner Trustee or the Indenture Trustee of the Proceeding; provided, that the failure to give such notice shall not affect the right of the Servicer to indemnification hereunder to the extent that such failure does not prejudice the rights of the Servicer or the Indemnified Person in such Proceeding. The Depositor, the Issuer, the Owner Trustee or the Indenture Trustee may participate in and assume the defense and settlement of a Proceeding at its expense. If the Depositor, the Issuer, the Owner Trustee or the Indenture Trustee notifies the Servicer of its intention to assume the defense of the Proceeding, the Depositor, the Issuer, the Owner Trustee or the Indenture Trustee will assume such defense with counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Servicer, and in a manner reasonably satisfactory to the Servicer, and the Depositor, the Issuer, the Owner Trustee or the Indenture Trustee, and will not be liable for fees and expenses of separate counsel to the Servicer unless there is a conflict between the interests of the Servicer and the Indemnified Person. If there is a conflict or if the parties cannot reasonably agree as to the selection of counsel, the Depositor, the Issuer, the Owner Trustee or the Indenture Trustee will pay the reasonable fees and expenses of separate counsel to the Servicer. No settlement of the Proceeding in which a claim is brought against the Servicer may be settled in the name of, on behalf of, or in any manner in which the Servicer is understood to acknowledge the validity of any claim without the approval of the Servicer and the Indemnified Person, which approvals will not be unreasonably withheld.

perturbation.explanation: By changing "provided, that the failure to give such notice shall not affect the right of the Servicer to indemnification hereunder to the extent that such failure does not prejudice the rights of the Servicer or the Indemnified Person in such Proceeding" to "even if the failure to give such notice affects the right of the Servicer to indemnification hereunder," creates a direct contradiction. The original text states the right to indemnification is preserved if no prejudice occurs due to lack of notice, and the amended text removes this condition, suggesting indemnification proceeds regardless of prejudice due to failed notice.
